section.p: This manual is a guide for Administrators of . It provides instructions on how to:
section.ul:
Block users,
Create users,
Create users in bulk,
Manage group admins,
Manage group properties,
Manage group members, and
Manage group moderation.

ol.li: Click Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Block Users, on the Group Administration page, to open the Block Users page.
Select the user/s you want to block and click on Add Users to Block list to add the user/s to the blocked user list. This add the selected user/s to the Members Currently Blocked from Posting.
To remove the user from the Block list, click on Remove users from Block list
Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Create Users.
Fill out the First Name, Preferred Name, Last Name and Email Address fields. The User ID field will default to a combination of your first and last names, but you may change this now if you wish.
You can choose to whether you want to Add to the group.
You can choose to whether you want to Require users to verify?
Click the Create User button.
If you have left Require users to verify? ticked an email will be sent to the new user requiring them to verify their email address.
When the the new user has verified their email address, they will be sent an email message from , which contains his or her login details.
If you have unticked Require users to verify? the new user will be sent an email message (a confirmation request), by , which contains his or her login details.

section.p: Create Bulk users requires a CSV (Comma Seperated Values) file. The CSV file must contain at least the first name, last name and email address of the user.

The creation of a large users may take a long time, and you may get a timeout. If this occurs, please do not retry until you have confirmed with the groupserver administrator that the users have not been created, otherwise double the number of users may be created. To reduce the chance of this happening, large numbers of users should be created in smaller batches (eg. 100 at a time).
Other values can be set at this time. Most of the roles are self explanatory. See Viewing Your Profile in The User Maunal.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Create Bulk Users.
Fill out the First Name, Preferred Name, Last Name and Email Address fields. The User ID field will default to a combination of your first and last names, but you may change this now if you wish.
You can choose to whether you want to Add to the group.
You can choose to whether you want to Require users to verify?
Click the Create User button
If you have left Require users to verify? ticked an email will be sent to the new users requiring them to verify their email address.
When the the new users have verified their email address they will be sent an email message by , which contains their login details.
If you have unticked Require users to verify? the new user will be sent an email message (a confirmation request), by , which contains your login details.

section.p: Group Administrators can be added and changed on this page.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Manage Group Admins, on the Group Administration page, to open the Manage Group Admins page.
Select the user/s you want to add as Group Administrator and click on Add Admins to Group to add the user/s as Admin of the Current Group.
To remove the user/s as Group Admin, click on Remove Admins from Group

section.p: Group Properties can be added and changed on this page. This is where the Online Groups Design is applied to the group.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Manage Group Properties, on the Group Administration page, to open the Manage Group Properties page.

section.p: You can set the Group Joinability so that the group can be joined by:

ul.li: Anyone, without approval — anyone can join
Anyone, pending approval — potential group members must apply to join
Only those invited — potential group members must be invited to joined to the group

section.p: To allow Anyone, without approval to join the the group.

ol.li: Set Group Visibility to either "Only division and group members" or "Everyone".
Set Joinability to "Anyone, without approval"
